alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Central and Southern Scott County; Conway; Faulkner; Garland; Lonoke; Monroe; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Northern Scott County; Northwest Yell County; Perry; Polk County Lower Elevations; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Western and Northern Logan County; White; Woodruff; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 05 at 5:07PM CDT until August 06 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Expect heat index values to peak near or just over 105. * WHERE...Portions of central, eastern and western Arkansas. * WHEN...From noon to 9 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
